SEARCH
Package civitas.celestis.graphics.util

Class Vertex

java.lang.Object
civitas.celestis.math.vector.Vector3
civitas.celestis.graphics.util.Vertex
All Implemented Interfaces:
Vector, Serializable
public class Vertex extends Vector3
A specialized Vector3 used in a graphical context.
See Also:

    • avg

      @Nonnull public static Vertex avg(@Nonnull Vertex... vertices)
      Given an array of vertices, this returns the average of the vectors. This is equivalent to the geometric centroid of the vertices.
      Parameters:
      vertices - Vertices to average
      Returns:
      The average of the given vertices

    • normal

      @Nonnull public static Vertex normal(@Nonnull Vertex a, @Nonnull Vertex b, @Nonnull Vertex c)
      Given three points which represent the vertices of a triangular surface, this calculates the surface normal. This method assumes that the given coordinates are in counter-clockwise order.
      Parameters:
      a - The first vertex
      b - The second vertex
      c - The third vertex
      Returns:
      The surface normal vertex

    • normalize

      @Nonnull public Vertex normalize()
      Normalizes this vertex. Unlike Vector3.normalize(), the return value of this method is guaranteed to have a magnitude of 1.
      Specified by:
      normalize in interface Vector
      Overrides:
      normalize in class Vector3
      Returns:
      The normalized vertex
      Throws:
      ArithmeticException - When the magnitude of this vertex is zero

    • max

      @Nonnull public Vertex max(@Nonnull Vector3 v)
      Returns the maximum vertex between this vertex and the provided vector v. This is calculated by applying Math.max(double, double) to all components.
      Overrides:
      max in class Vector3
      Parameters:
      v - Vector to get the maximum between
      Returns:
      Maximum vertex of the two vectors

      @Nonnull public Vertex min(@Nonnull Vector3 v)

      Overrides:

      Transforms this vertex into a relative coordinate system.
      Parameters:

      rotation - The rotation to apply to this vertex

      Returns:

    • position

      @Nonnull public Position position(double focalLength)
      Converts this vertex to a 2D position with the provided focal length.

      This assumes that this vertex is already converted to a relative coordinate system, the Z coordinate represents depth, and X and Y represent width and height respectively.

      Parameters:
      focalLength - The focal length to use in conversion
      Returns:
      The converted position

      Returns:

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      The parsed string
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - When the format is invalid
